2015.context: Arista Networks, Inc. is a cloud networking company focused on data center switches, network operating systems, and cloud networking. Disrupting Cisco in data center switching. EOS operating system advantage.

competitors.name: Cisco Systems
competitors.notes: Primary competitor, Nexus 9000 series directly competed with Arista switches in data center networking

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Competed in networking space with switches, routers, and security solutions for data centers and service providers

competitors.name: HPE/Aruba Networks
competitors.notes: Strong presence in campus networking, offering wired and wireless networking solutions

competitors.name: Huawei Technologies
competitors.notes: Major competitor in data center switching, particularly strong outside the United States

competitors.name: Dell Technologies
competitors.notes: Provided networking solutions for data centers with focus on seamless scaling and upgrades

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Offered networking solutions including switches and wireless competing in enterprise space

competitors.name: Mellanox
competitors.notes: High-performance networking solutions for HPC and data center environments before NVIDIA acquisition

2020.context: Arista Networks, Inc. is a cloud networking company focused on data center switches, network operating systems, and cloud networking. Cloud titan customers (Microsoft, Meta) driving growth. 100G/400G adoption.

competitors.name: Cisco Systems
competitors.notes: Primary competitor with comprehensive networking portfolio, ACI SDN solution competed with Arista's network automation offerings

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Major competitor providing switches, routers, and security solutions targeting data centers and service providers

competitors.name: HPE/Aruba Networks
competitors.notes: Strong competitor in campus networking with wired and wireless solutions

competitors.name: Mellanox/NVIDIA
competitors.notes: High-performance networking solutions for AI/ML workloads and data centers, acquired by NVIDIA in 2020

competitors.name: Huawei Technologies
competitors.notes: Major global competitor in ICT infrastructure, offering telecom networks, IT solutions and cloud services

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Delivered software-driven networking solutions for enterprise customers

competitors.name: Pluribus Networks
competitors.notes: Performance-oriented network virtualization for private and public cloud data centers

competitors.name: Dell Technologies
competitors.notes: Networking solutions leveraging SONiC open-source network operating system

2024.context: Arista Networks, Inc. is a cloud networking company focused on data center switches, network operating systems, and cloud networking. AI data center networking demand surge. Campus networking expansion.

competitors.name: Cisco Systems
competitors.notes: Major competitor in data center switching, though Arista showed highest 'ability to execute' in Gartner's Magic Quadrant

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Key competitor integrating automation and AI-driven technologies for network performance and security

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Rising challenger with InfiniBand and Spectrum-X Ethernet gaining adoption for AI system back-end networks

competitors.name: Huawei Technologies
competitors.notes: Gartner leader with highest 'completeness of vision' mark, strong global presence

competitors.name: HPE
competitors.notes: Positioned as 'challenger' in Gartner ranking with Aruba networking solutions

competitors.name: Dell Technologies
competitors.notes: Labeled as 'visionary' by Gartner, projected $2B revenue from SONiC-embedded switches

competitors.name: H3C
competitors.notes: Niche player in data center switching market

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Niche player offering software-driven networking solutions

competitors.name: Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise
competitors.notes: Niche player in enterprise networking

2025.context: Arista Networks, Inc. is a cloud networking company focused on data center switches, network operating systems, and cloud networking. AI infrastructure leader for hyperscalers. 800G networking and AI fabric solutions.

competitors.name: Cisco Systems
competitors.notes: Primary competitor with Cisco ACI leading alternative solution per G2 rankings

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Major competitor in cloud networking and data center infrastructure

competitors.name: Dell EMC
competitors.notes: Significant competitor in networking solutions

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: G2's top alternative with Virtual GPU, strong in AI networking infrastructure

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Listed as top alternative per G2 rankings

competitors.name: Huawei Technologies
competitors.notes: Global competitor in networking infrastructure

competitors.name: Fortinet
competitors.notes: Competitor focused on security networking solutions

competitors.name: F5 Networks
competitors.notes: Competitor focused on security networking solutions

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Offering cloud and data solutions for enterprise digital transformation

mentionedBy.name: Cisco Systems Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Focused on high-end, high-performance networking devices

mentionedBy.name: Cisco Systems Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Run by ex-Cisco exec Jayshree Ullal, focused on cloud-based networking and data centers

mentionedBy.name: Cisco Systems Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Run by ex-Cisco exec Jayshree Ullal, extended data-center technology to campus and edge

mentionedBy.name: Cisco Systems Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Focuses on high-speed datacenter and cloud networking, products compete directly with Cisco's Nexus and Catalyst switches

mentionedBy.name: Cisco Systems Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Cloud networking solutions provider gaining traction in data center and cloud environments, challenging Cisco's market share in modern infrastructure.
